items.sentence: Tom walked across the hall to see what was happening.
It would be nice if you were able to do that with us.
I wouldn't want to do that unless you did it with me.
You could incriminate yourself if you aren't careful.
Only our close relatives were invited to our wedding.
How is Tom going to be able to do that before Monday?
There's no reason to believe that things will change.
Many of our children are suffering from malnutrition.
I've never met Tom and don't know what he looks like.
We can't rule that out, but it seems highly unlikely.
Tom picked up the book that had fallen off the table.
The plane might leave without you if you don't hurry.
The dress in the show window caught Mary's attention.
I don't think that we should say anything about that.
It's not as if I had read all the books on the shelf.
It looked like you were going to fall off the ladder.
Italo Calvino was born on the island of Cuba in 1923.
Tom knew that what he'd been asked to do was illegal.
All these people need to be hospitalized and treated.
Tom wouldn't have done that if we'd asked him not to.
